byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and SUSANNE CRAIG

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and Gov Andrew M Cuomo speak on telephone after nearly month of avoiding interactions with each other; Cuomo does not divulge content of conversation, but de Blasio hints that longstanding feud may not be over.
lead_paragraph: After a month of not speaking to each other, Mayor Bill de Blasio and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had a phone conversation last week. But they have not yet settled their differences.

headline.main: Cuomo and de Blasio End the Silence, but Not the Feud
headline.print_headline: Cuomo and de Blasio End the Silence, but Not the Feud

snippet: After a month of not speaking to each other, Mayor Bill de Blasio and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had a phone conversation last week. But they have not yet settled their differences.
